content: cables dayflower lace and a leafy edging adorn the edge of this crescent-shaped shawlette perfect for that special small skein the narrow lace border is worked long-ways using a method of keeping live stitches on the needle that eliminates the need to pick up stitches for the body of the shawl this pattern contains lace charts as well as full written directions for the lace border **materials** approximately 300 yds of an appropriate lace-weight yarn sample shown in malabrigo lace superwash archangel us 4/3 5 mm 32 inch circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge yarn needle **gauge** 19 sts x 46 row in 4 inches 10 cm in stockinette stitch after blocking note exact gauge is not necessary having trouble getting started with the m1e check out this post 1 from the beginning lace knitters group which features a photo tutorial of initial row thanks judiths2 for sharing **errata** *fixed in current version of pattern* there was a stitch count error in row 6 and 14 in the dayflower lace portion of the border the written instructions and the charts have been fixed and updated both row should read row 6 & 14 k1 k2 p1 2x k6 **p17** p1 tbl m1e turn please download the new version thanks regina marie is now available in spanish many thanks to amaya rodrigo amayita /people/amayita for the translation 1 http //www ravelry com/discuss/beginning-lace-knitters/3271757/51-75#71
